intro: Tetramerium calderonii, commonly known as the Mexican tetramerium, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study and conservation efforts.
